question_stem:
In the One-Way ANOVA, we assume the following model:
Yij=μ+αi+eij,i=1,…,k,j=1,…,ni\begin{equation} Y_{ij} = \mu + \alpha_i + e_{ij},\; i=1,\ldots,k,\; j=1,\ldots,n_i \end{equation}
The use of C(type, Treatment) in Python corresponds to the following constraints when performing estimation:

Setting α1=0\alpha_1= 0.

The use of C(type, Treatment) in Python corresponds to the following constraints when performing estimation:

  • Setting α1=0\alpha_1= 0.

items.solution: C(type, Sum) is for the Sum contrast.
